Description: Body fragment of an East Greek pottery closed vase; outside glazed black save two narrow reserved bands near the centre of the fragment; two bands of added red lined in white.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit: 'R.M. Cook (GPP 140) notes late seventh century East Greek cups with similar ornament.'
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 59, no. 212 pl. 49)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.151)
